### Background
This is the **upper** reach of the larger turbulent mountain stream, Blackwood Creek in CA, USA.

#### Identifying reasonable modeled estimates of K600
We then ran the normal stream metabolizer model: `b_Kb_oipi_tr_plrckm.stan` to get modeled K600 to see if we could resolve the negative correlation between ER and K600.
Priors on `K600_lnQ_nodes_meanlog` were set as 5 bins based on `rnorm(1000, mean = logQ_mean, sd = logQ_sd)` centered around the mean and logQ values 1-2 sd away from the mean. 

##### Load different model segments with normal prior for gas exchange. 
We chose segments of time where we believe GPP occurred and was greater than 0. 
These chunks of time are from a previous model where we binned flow and incorporated measured and estimated K600 priors from gas exchange measurements a the reach. 

```{r, warning=F, size = 'small', echo=FALSE}
input_dat <- readRDS("./25_BWU_mod_dat.rds") 

measured_K <- read.csv("./ArN_NEON_K_BWL_notpooled_241204.csv")%>%
  mutate(date= as.Date(date, format=c("%m/%d/%y")))  %>%
  filter(date>as.Date("2024-06-26"))
measured_K$source <- ("measured")


met.full <- read_csv("./BWU_Full_2025-02-04_daily.csv") %>%
  mutate(year = year(date))%>%
  mutate(jday = yday(date))%>%
  mutate(mon = month(date))%>%
   mutate(lab = "Full")%>%
  mutate(NEP_daily_mean = GPP_daily_mean + ER_daily_mean)  

fits.full <- read_csv("./BWU_Full_2025-02-04_errors.csv_mod_and_obs_DO.csv") %>%
  mutate(week = week(solar.time))%>%
  mutate(jday = yday(solar.time)) %>%
     mutate(lab = "Full")%>%
  mutate(
    DO_pr_sat = c((DO.obs/DO.sat) * 100), 
    DO_pr_sat_mod = c((DO.mod/DO.sat) * 100))

```

### Metabolism with CIs for the full time series 
This the raw model output. It looks okay aside from some small parts of 2023.
Where GPP is in blue and ER is in orange, and the black points represent NEP.

**Here is the run configuration for full model:**

`mm_name(type = 'bayes', pool_K600 = "binned", err_obs_iid = TRUE, err_proc_iid = TRUE, ode_method = "trapezoid", deficit_src = 'DO_mod', engine = 'stan')`

**Fitting priors:**

`K600_lnQ_nodes_meanlog = log(16)` Where 16 was the mean value from observed measurements and normal pooled modeled, 
`K600_lnQ_nodes_sdlog = 1.31` 
`bayes_specs_new$K600_lnQ_nodes_centers <- log_bins` was from `prior_samples <- rnorm(1000, mean = logQ_mean, sd = logQ_sd)`

### Checking full model convergence
Make sure the chains converged; all r-hat values were well below 1.05 (the red line)
for GPP, ER, and K600. 
The blue lines are the mean for each parameter.

Looks like that weird 2023 time period corresponds to bad rhats for all parameters.

### Full run with binned K600 informed by both measured and modeled priors

**Here is the run configuration for full model:**

`mm_name(type = 'bayes', pool_K600 = "binned", err_obs_iid = TRUE, err_proc_iid = TRUE, ode_method = "trapezoid", deficit_src = 'DO_mod', engine = 'stan')`


#### Quick plot of flow bins given flow range:
Where dashed vertical lines correspond to the prior locations for flow bins in `bayes_specs_new$K600_lnQ_nodes_centers <- log_bins`
```{r, warning=F, size = 'small', echo=FALSE, fig.align = "center", fig.width=9, fig.height = 3}
# Compute log-transformed discharge
logQ <- log(na.omit(input_dat$discharge))
sd_logQ <- round(sd(na.omit(logQ)),2)

## Compute log-transformed K600 for prior estimation
logQ_mean <- round(mean(logQ, na.rm = TRUE),2)  # Center the prior on observed mean
logQ_sd <- round(c(sd(logQ, na.rm = TRUE)),1)  # Double the SD for a wider prior


logK600_mean <- round(log(16),1)  # Center the prior on observed mean
logK600_sd <- round(c(log((29.2/15.8)*2)),2)  # Double the SD for a wider prior

prior_samples <- rnorm(1000, mean = logQ_mean, sd = logQ_sd)
# Convert back from log-scale to natural scale
# Define bin edges based on log-scale mean and SD
log_bins <- c(logQ_mean - c(2 * logQ_sd), 
              logQ_mean - c(1 * logQ_sd), 
              logQ_mean, 
              logQ_mean + c(1 * logQ_sd), 
              logQ_mean + c(2 * logQ_sd))

# Convert bins to log scale
bins <- exp(log_bins)
prior_df <- data.frame(Q_cms = prior_samples)
prior_bins_plot <- ggplot(prior_df, aes(x = Q_cms)) +
  geom_density(fill = "lightblue", alpha = 0.5) +  # Density plot
  geom_vline(xintercept = log_bins, color = "black", lty="dashed") +  # Bin edges
  labs(title = "Binned log(flow) for K600 Priors", y = "Density", x = "log(Q) (cms)") +
  theme_bw()
prior_bins_plot
```

The vertical dashed is the overall mean modeled K600 in the box plot. 


##### GPP and ER ?
```{r, warning=F, size = 'small', echo=F, fig.align = "center", fig.width=8, fig.height = 5}
GPP_E_cor <-round(cor(met.clean$GPP_daily_mean, met.clean$ER_daily_mean, use = "complete.obs"),3)
print(GPP_E_cor)


kgpp <- ggplot(met.clean, aes(y = (ER_daily_mean*-1), x = GPP_daily_mean, col = as.factor(lab)))+
  geom_point(size = 2)+  geom_smooth(method="lm", se=F, color="grey50",lty="dashed") +
  theme_bw()+
  scale_color_viridis_d(option = "inferno") +
  theme(legend.position = "null")
kgpp

```

The direction of the K600 ~ flow relationship looks more logical, where K600 increases with flow.
ER and K600 are positively correlated (0.686), GPP and K600 are negatively correlated (-0.587). but, less strongly relative to the lower reach (GBL). The relationship between K600 and flow appears to be positive but still inflected in a strange way. 

However I'm still think we should be cautious in over interpreting ER trends. 

The mean modeled K600 is lower than expected, 6.50 when it should be closer to 16.

### Table summarizing excluded data from cleaned model output: 

```{r, warning=F, size = 'small', echo=FALSE, fig.width=5, fig.height=12}

#####
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(lubridate)
library(knitr)
library(kableExtra)

# ---- 1) Define "full DO days" from input_dat (48 half-hour intervals) ----
do_days <- input_dat %>%
  mutate(date = as.Date(solar.time)) %>%
  group_by(date) %>%
  summarise(
    n_intervals = sum(!is.na(DO.obs)),   # or use !is.na(DO.sat) depending on your definition
    .groups = "drop"
  ) %>%
  mutate(full_DO_day = n_intervals >= 48)

total_DO_days_any   <- n_distinct(do_days$date)
total_DO_days_full  <- sum(do_days$full_DO_day, na.rm = TRUE)

full_DO_dates <- do_days %>% filter(full_DO_day) %>% pull(date)

# ---- 2) Day-level metabolism table and flags ----
met_day <- met.full %>%
  mutate(date = as.Date(date)) %>%
  distinct(date, .keep_all = TRUE)  # ensure one row per day; remove if already guaranteed daily

met_days_modeled_any <- n_distinct(met_day$date)

# Join metabolism onto full DO days only (this makes denominators explicit)
met_class <- tibble(date = full_DO_dates) %>%
  left_join(met_day, by = "date") %>%
  mutate(
    has_any_metab = !is.na(GPP_mean) | !is.na(ER_mean) | !is.na(K600_daily_mean),

    # "clean" criteria
    clean_GPP  = !is.na(GPP_daily_Rhat)  & GPP_daily_Rhat  <= 1.05 & !is.na(GPP_2.5pct)  & GPP_2.5pct  >= 0,
    clean_ER   = !is.na(ER_daily_Rhat)   & ER_daily_Rhat   <= 1.05 & !is.na(ER_97.5pct)  & ER_97.5pct  <= 0,
    clean_K600 = !is.na(K600_daily_Rhat) & K600_daily_Rhat <= 1.05,

    clean_all  = clean_GPP & clean_ER & clean_K600,

    # "unreasonable" estimates
    unreasonable_GPP = !is.na(GPP_daily_Rhat) & !is.na(GPP_97.5pct) & (GPP_daily_Rhat > 1.05 & GPP_97.5pct < 0),
    unreasonable_ER  = !is.na(ER_daily_Rhat)  & !is.na(ER_2.5pct)   & (ER_daily_Rhat > 1.05 & ER_2.5pct > 0),
    poor_K600        = !is.na(K600_daily_Rhat) & (K600_daily_Rhat > 1.05)
  )

# ---- 3) Counts (all denominators based on FULL DO DAYS) ----
denom <- length(full_DO_dates)

n_metab_any   <- sum(met_class$has_any_metab, na.rm = TRUE)
n_metab_none  <- denom - n_metab_any

n_clean_all   <- sum(met_class$clean_all, na.rm = TRUE)
n_clean_gpp   <- sum(met_class$clean_GPP, na.rm = TRUE)
n_clean_er    <- sum(met_class$clean_ER, na.rm = TRUE)
n_clean_k600  <- sum(met_class$clean_K600, na.rm = TRUE)

n_unr_gpp     <- sum(met_class$unreasonable_GPP, na.rm = TRUE)
n_unr_er      <- sum(met_class$unreasonable_ER, na.rm = TRUE)
n_poor_k600   <- sum(met_class$poor_K600, na.rm = TRUE)

# ---- 4) Build a clearer summary table ----
excluded_summary <- tibble(
  Metric = c(
   # "Total DO days (any coverage)",
    "Total DO days (FULL: >= 48 half-hour intervals)",
    "Days with ANY metabolism output (on full DO days)",
    "Days with NO metabolism output (on full DO days)",
    "Days with CLEAN metabolism (GPP+ER+K600 all pass)",
    "Days with CLEAN GPP (Rhat<=1.05 & GPP_2.5pct>=0)",
    "Days with CLEAN ER (Rhat<=1.05 & ER_97.5pct<=0)",
    "Days with CLEAN K600 (Rhat<=1.05)",
    "Days with UNREASONABLE GPP (Rhat>1.05 & GPP_97.5pct<0)",
    "Days with UNREASONABLE ER (Rhat>1.05 & ER_2.5pct>0)",
    "Days with poor K600 (Rhat>1.05)"
  ),
  `Number of Days` = c(
   # total_DO_days_any,
    denom,
    n_metab_any,
    n_metab_none,
    n_clean_all,
    n_clean_gpp,
    n_clean_er,
    n_clean_k600,
    n_unr_gpp,
    n_unr_er,
    n_poor_k600
  ),
  `Percent of FULL DO days` = c(
   # round(total_DO_days_any / denom * 100, 1),
    100.0,
    round(n_metab_any  / denom * 100, 1),
    round(n_metab_none / denom * 100, 1),
    round(n_clean_all  / denom * 100, 1),
    round(n_clean_gpp  / denom * 100, 1),
    round(n_clean_er   / denom * 100, 1),
    round(n_clean_k600 / denom * 100, 1),
    round(n_unr_gpp    / denom * 100, 1),
    round(n_unr_er     / denom * 100, 1),
    round(n_poor_k600  / denom * 100, 1)
  )
)

excluded_summary %>%
  kable() %>%
  kable_styling(font_size = 15) %>%
  row_spec(0, bold = TRUE, font_size = 16)
```

  col_scale +

kgpp <- ggplot(plot_dat,
               aes(x = GPP_daily_mean,
                   y = K600_daily_mean,
                   color = factor(water_year))) +
  geom_point(size = 2, alpha = 0.85) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE, linetype = "dashed",
              color = "grey40") +
  labs(x = gpp_unit, y = k600_unit) +
  col_scale +
  base_theme

k.q <- ggplot(plot_dat,
              aes(x = discharge,
                  y = K600_daily_mean,
                  color = factor(water_year))) +
  geom_point(size = 2, alpha = 0.85) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE, linetype = "dashed",
              color = "grey40") +
  labs(x = q_unit, y = k600_unit) +
  col_scale +
  base_theme

ER_gpp <- plot_dat %>%
  mutate(negER = -ER_daily_mean) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = negER,
             y = GPP_daily_mean,
             color = factor(water_year))) +
  geom_point(size = 2, alpha = 0.85) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE, linetype = "dashed",
              color = "grey40") +
  labs(
    x = expression(paste("\u2212ER (g O"[2], " ", m^{-2}, " ", d^{-1}, ")")),
    y = gpp_unit
  ) +
  col_scale +
  base_theme


legend <- cowplot::get_legend(ker)

p1 <- cowplot::plot_grid(
  ker + theme(legend.position = "none"),
  kgpp + theme(legend.position = "none"),
  k.q + theme(legend.position = "none"),
  ER_gpp + theme(legend.position = "none"),
  labels = c("A","B","C","D"),
  ncol = 2
)

final_plot <- cowplot::plot_grid(p1, legend, rel_widths = c(1, 0.18))
final_plot
